metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5052 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An incorrect assumption about block structure in Blink in Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.133 for Mac, Windows, and Linux, and 57.0.2987.132 for Android, allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit memory corruption via a crafted HTML page that triggers improper casting.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5052` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1277').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
